https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/ztx6fzEpBwCWhGNr0WEuB81oBKh.jpg Is having control of our life a right? Are living and dying freedoms, duties or responsibilities? How should we love? How should we live? How should we die? These questions are woven into the story of Adrien, who suffers from kidney failure. He runs a garage in Trois-Pistoles, a small town on the St-Lawrence in Qu√©bec, where people seem ordinary, but aren't: each love story, each life, each destiny is unique. Adrien
